slidelink.displaytext: Conditions such as Ulcerative colitis, celiac disease, Irritable bowel syndrome (I B S) can affect:
This condition is a consequence from Nutritional deficiency, Gastrointestinal bleeding and Excessive menses.

This condition is a consequence from Nutritional deficiency, Gastrointestinal bleeding and Excessive menses. Infants, pregnant women, young children, and elderly individuals are vulnerable population.
C B C ↓ Red count ↓ Hemoglobin ↓ Hematocrit ↓ M C V (microcytic) ↓ M C H C (hypochromic) ↑ R D W
What is the range for Transferrin Saturation
What is the range for Serum ferritin
What is the range for TIBC

Most common anemias in hospital population due to secondary condition. Iron is blocked from reaching erythroid precursors due to impaired release from macrophages, also there is impaired E P O production.
Hbg, Hct is on the bordline MCHC is normal, MCV is slightly low, Serum iron is low, serum ferritin is normal or increased, TIBC is decreased.
Accumulation of iron in the mitochondria Slight hypochromia Inherited or acquired If X-linked Mutations in A L A S 2 gene If autosomal recessive Mutations in the S L C 2 5 A 3 8
Alcoholism, isoniazid, chloramphenicol and copper deficiency develops into it, also noticed in myelodysplastic condition. Which condition is it?
Microcytic and hypochromic anemia, this condition express Splenomegaly, Increased serum ferritin, Increased protoporphyrin and Increased serum iron.
Which of these condition you see pappenheimer bodies and dimorphism?
Anemia Hepatosplenomegaly Skin discoloration Jaundice Peculiar facial features Bone changes
Which of these condition you see pappenheimer bodies and dimorphism?

Inherited iron overloading causing unbalanced iron absorption and storage, Iron accumulates on tissue. It is an autosomal recessive disorder on chromosome 6.
Abnormal genes: HFE with mutation on C282Y and H63D
Chronic fatigue and weakness Cirrhosis of the liver Hyperpigmentation Diabetes Impotence
